title: Find Beautiful Indices In The Given Array I
description:
You are given a 0-indexed string s, a string a, a string b, and an integer k.
An index i is beautiful if:

0 <= i <= s.length - a.length
s[i..(i + a.length - 1)] == a
There exists an index j such that:
	
0 <= j <= s.length - b.length
s[j..(j + b.length - 1)] == b
|j - i| <= k



Return the array that contains beautiful indices in sorted order from smallest to largest.
 
Example 1:

Input: s = "isawsquirrelnearmysquirrelhouseohmy", a = "my", b = "squirrel", k = 15
Output: [16,33]
Explanation: There are 2 beautiful indices: [16,33].
- The index 16 is beautiful as s[16..17] == "my" and there exists an index 4 with s[4..11] == "squirrel" and |16 - 4| <= 15.
- The index 33 is beautiful as s[33..34] == "my" and there exists an index 18 with s[18..25] == "squirrel" and |33 - 18| <= 15.
Thus we return [16,33] as the result.

Example 2:

Input: s = "abcd", a = "a", b = "a", k = 4
Output: [0]
Explanation: There is 1 beautiful index: [0].
- The index 0 is beautiful as s[0..0] == "a" and there exists an index 0 with s[0..0] == "a" and |0 - 0| <= 4.
Thus we return [0] as the result.

 
Constraints:

1 <= k <= s.length <= 105
1 <= a.length, b.length <= 10
s, a, and b contain only lowercase English letters.
starter_code:
class Solution:
    def beautifulIndices(self, s: str, a: str, b: str, k: int) -> List[int]:
preamble:

from itertools import *

import math, collections, functools, itertools, bisect, heapq, string, re
check_function:
def check(candidate):
    assert candidate(s = "beautifulbeautifulbeautiful",a = "ful",b = "aut",k = 5) == [6, 15, 24]
    assert candidate(s = "hellobeautifulworld",a = "be",b = "autiful",k = 5) == [5]
    assert candidate(s = "beautifulbeautifulbeautiful",a = "ful",b = "uti",k = 5) == [6, 15, 24]
    assert candidate(s = "hellohellohello",a = "he",b = "lo",k = 3) == [0, 5, 10]
    assert candidate(s = "beautifulday",a = "day",b = "beat",k = 10) == []
    assert candidate(s = "abababab",a = "ab",b = "ba",k = 2) == [0, 2, 4, 6]
    assert candidate(s = "abcabcabcabc",a = "ab",b = "bc",k = 3) == [0, 3, 6, 9]
    assert candidate(s = "hellohellohello",a = "he",b = "lo",k = 2) == [5, 10]
    assert candidate(s = "abcd",a = "a",b = "a",k = 4) == [0]
    assert candidate(s = "aaaaaa",a = "aa",b = "aaa",k = 2) == [0, 1, 2, 3, 4]
    assert candidate(s = "isawsquirrelnearmysquirrelhouseohmy",a = "my",b = "squirrel",k = 15) == [16, 33]
    assert candidate(s = "abababab",a = "ab",b = "ba",k = 1) == [0, 2, 4, 6]
    assert candidate(s = "hellotherehello",a = "he",b = "lo",k = 5) == [0, 6, 10]
    assert candidate(s = "teststringteststring",a = "test",b = "ing",k = 10) == [0, 10]
    assert candidate(s = "abcabcabcabc",a = "abc",b = "cab",k = 3) == [0, 3, 6, 9]
    assert candidate(s = "beautifulbeautiful",a = "ful",b = "uti",k = 5) == [6, 15]
    assert candidate(s = "hellobeautifulworld",a = "bea",b = "ful",k = 7) == [5]
    assert candidate(s = "overlappingoverlappingoverlapping",a = "over",b = "lapping",k = 10) == [0, 11, 22]
    assert candidate(s = "overlappingoverlappingoverlapping",a = "over",b = "lap",k = 5) == [0, 11, 22]
    assert candidate(s = "randomstringwithrandomstringinside",a = "random",b = "inside",k = 25) == [16]
    assert candidate(s = "qwertyuiopqwertyuiop",a = "erty",b = "rtyu",k = 8) == [2, 12]
    assert candidate(s = "abababababab",a = "aba",b = "bab",k = 2) == [0, 2, 4, 6, 8]
    assert candidate(s = "repeatedwordrepeatedwordrepeated",a = "word",b = "repeated",k = 10) == [8, 20]
    assert candidate(s = "xyxxyxyxyxyxxyxyxyxy",a = "xy",b = "yx",k = 4) == [0, 3, 5, 7, 9, 12, 14, 16, 18]
    assert candidate(s = "mississippi",a = "iss",b = "sis",k = 3) == [1, 4]
    assert candidate(s = "uniquestringswithvariouslengthsandcharacters",a = "strings",b = "length",k = 25) == [6]
    assert candidate(s = "longestsubstringhereandthere",a = "long",b = "here",k = 12) == []
    assert candidate(s = "bananaananabanana",a = "ana",b = "nan",k = 4) == [1, 3, 6, 8, 12, 14]
